snippet: A creation made of composite paper can fold and assemble itself and start working without intervention. Such robots could be deployed cheaply and quickly.
abstract: Creation of robot made of composite paper that can fold itself and start working without any intervention from operator is reported in journal Science; robot, created by Harvard graduate student Samuel Felton, is inspired by origami, Japanese paper-folding art.
lead_paragraph: A creation made of composite paper can fold and assemble itself and start working without intervention. Such robots could be deployed cheaply and quickly.

headline.main: Origami Inspires Rise of Self-Folding Robot
headline.print_headline: Origami Inspires Rise of Self-Folding Robot
